title: Wes Nelson hints Celebrity X Factor band is divided
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest Daily Love Island stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Wes Nelson has cast concern over his Celebrity X Factor chances after admitting there is already tension in his band.

The Love Island Lothario is performing as part of a supergroup of ex islanders made up of Eyal Booker, Zara McDermott and Samira Mighty .

But despite the band's shared history , Wes and his teammates appear to be experiencing some creative differences ahead of the competition.

Outspoken Wes says he hates the name they've been given by X Factor producers and is refusing to use it.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: Instagram)

"It's a touchy subject. I'm not saying 'The Islanders'. I'll look like a f***ing idiot," Wes fumed in an interview with Heat magazine.

Band member Eyal then tried to defuse the situation by admitting, "We're still undecided. It's The Islanders for now."

'Diva' Wes was also outed for his unprofessional ways by his bandmates.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX/Shutterstock)

"Wes is always late!" complained the usually 'Zen' Eyal.

"I'm not a diva!" Wes insisted. "I still don't consider myself a celebrity, I hate saying that word. We just want to be known for something other than dating."

(Image: Supplied by WENN)

The foursome revealed they'd actually auditioned for Simon Cowell's latest project separately before being put together - 'like Little Mix', they claim.

They also predicted they might be put in the 'groups' category after being ITV bosses 'heard them harmonising' together in the villa.

Though they claim scenes of them performing never went to air because of 'copyright issues'

(Image: PA)

(Image: PA)

(Image: PA)

Joining The Islanders in the group category are Try Star made up of Thom Evans, Levi Davis and Ben Foden. Brendan Cole and Jeremy Edwards will also form a singing duo.

While Megan McKenna, Glee’s Kevin McHale, EastEnders’ Jonny Labey will all be competing in the Unders category.

The Overs consists of journalist Martin Bashir, actress Victoria Ekanoye and talk show host Ricki Lake.

Find out how they fare when the show kicks off this weekend.

The X Factor: Celebrity airs on ITV 12 October at 8:35pm
description: The Love Island Lothario has teamed up with Eyal Booker, Zara McDermott and Samira Mighty in the hopes of winning a recording contract from the first Celebrity X Factor
